error.signature: OpenSearch cluster status is RED: one or more primary shards are not allocated

verdict.summary: OpenSearch cluster is in RED status meaning primary shards are unassigned, usually due to storage pressure or node failures.

dead_ends.action: Force delete unassigned shards to turn cluster green
dead_ends.why_fails: Deleting primary shards causes permanent data loss for those indices

dead_ends.action: Upgrade instance types to fix red cluster status
dead_ends.why_fails: If the issue is disk pressure, upgrading instance type without adding storage won't help

workarounds.action: Increase storage volume size and check for disk pressure
workarounds.how: Check FreeStorageSpace metric in CloudWatch; increase EBS volume size via domain configuration

workarounds.action: Delete old indices or use Index State Management (ISM) policies for lifecycle management
workarounds.how: Delete indices older than retention period; create ISM policy to auto-delete or move to cold storage

frequently_confused_with.distinction: ElastiCache connection is about Redis/Memcached access; OpenSearch cluster red is about Elasticsearch/OpenSearch shard health
